cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi E of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Florence will drift slowly westward over southeastern North Carolina today, then curl west-southwest tonight and Saturday before turning generally north across the western Carolinas, central Appalachians, and toward the Northeast early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches confined to Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings from South Santee River SC to Duck NC; tropical-storm warnings north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and parts of Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina coast for landfall; broader impacts across the Mid-Atlantic states.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible early next week; chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds is only 4%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York Harbor given track well inland and weak onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant system could bring periods of moderate rain (1–3 inches) Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river and urban flooding possible if bands stall over the metropolitan area.
